metadata.title: BitSightWFHData
metadata.description: This playbook provides an end to end example of the collection of WFH information from BitSight. This will extract the IP from network session ASIM data and call the WFH api of BitSight to get the data of that specific IP and store the relevant WFH custom log table into a log analytic workspace.
prerequisites: 1. Users must have a valid bitsight API token.
2. Need to create a key vault in Microsoft sentinel and store the API token as secret with the name â€œAPI-token
3. User needs to have one active log analytic workspace to ingest the WFH data.
postDeployment: Once deployment is complete, authorize each connection.
1. Click the Custom Connector connection resource

metadata.description: The unique identifier of the Azure Log Analytics workspace.
The primary or secondary key of the Azure Log Analytics workspace.
The table name in which WFH Data will get store.
